page.title: 15VALE ROYAL ABBEY, WHITEGATE
page.content: { (The Lodge)} This is a lodge which was originally built as the gatehouse for Vale Royal Abbey, but now it is used as a cottage. The building is not very big, but the owners are not allowed to extend more than once and this has already happened when the previous owners built the lounge. They had to acquire sandstone from Cumbria because the material had to be exactly the same as the original building. This is because the Department of the Environment is preserving the Lodge as a piece of historical evidence. The Lodge is situated at the end of the long drive from the Abbey.
